cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 245 miles SSE of Port O’Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the middle Texas coast and expected to stall near or just inland of the coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Port O’Connor/Rockport on the middle Texas coast

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning (also under Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch south of Port Mansfield to the Mouth of the Rio Grande
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Port Mansfield to Sargent, TX; Storm Surge Warning from Port Mansfield to High Island, TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast from Port Mansfield to High Island
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds (85+ mph) likely Friday night with gusts possibly exceeding 100 mph near landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 6–12 ft possible from the National Seashore entrance northward to Sargent, including Calhoun/Port O’Connor area.
weather_observation.rainfall: 15–25 inches with isolated totals up to 35 inches, leading to life-threatening flash and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornadoes possible on the middle and upper Texas coast.
